title: How sea anemones living on deep-sea hydrothermal vents avoid metal poisoning
description: The anemone Alvinactis idsseensis dominates its toxic environment thanks to an unusual number of genes geared toward protecting cells from heavy metals.

title: Giant planet ‘destabilization’ may have coincided with the birth of Earth’s moon
description: New meteorite data suggest the orbits of the giant planets abruptly changed about 60 million to 100 million years after the solar system started forming.

title: Most of today’s gene therapies rely on viruses — and that’s a problem
description: The next big strides in gene therapy for rare diseases may come from CRISPR and new approaches to delivery.
